references.reason: This is the most important reference as it is the only known result that achieves sublinear bounds in both sampling complexity and query time, which is the main focus of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Maximum selection and sorting with adversarial comparators
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical foundation for the density estimation problem, particularly in adversarial settings, which is relevant to the lower bound analysis in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Subsets and supermajorities: Optimal hashing-based set similarity search
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel lower bound for set similarity search problems, which directly inspires the lower bound techniques used in the current paper to demonstrate a novel statistical-computational trade-off.

references.paper_title: Optimal hashing-based time-space trade-offs for approximate near neighbors
references.reason: This paper establishes state-of-the-art results in approximate nearest neighbor search, which serves as a crucial building block and comparison point for the density estimation data structures investigated in the current paper.

references.paper_title: The structure of optimal private tests for simple hypotheses
references.reason: This paper provides insights into the fundamental limits of hypothesis testing in the presence of privacy constraints, which is relevant to the density estimation problem, especially when considering privacy-preserving data structures.
